p: Whereas DENV-1 was detected only in 2 patients from Rupandehi district and DENV-3 was detected only in 1 patient from Bardiya district; DENV-2 had a much broader geographic distribution and was detected in patients from Sarlahi, Chitwan, Jhapa, Makwanpur, Kaski, Dhading, and Kapilvastu. Heterospecific DENV circulation was found in Province 5 ( Table 4). DENV-2, which has been the most dominant serotype in Nepal since 2004, was prevalent in the hilly districts of Province 3 (Makawanpur, n = 1 and Dhading, n = 1) and Province 4 (Kaski, n = 1).
